title: How would you update Will Durant's '100 best Books for an Education'? - Quora

response.answer_text: What a great question! It caused me to scratch my head somewhat, because the list is so long- and making the choice of what to weed, and what to include is so difficult. And then I found that the list has already been ‘modernized’. The new and improved one is here: One Hundred Best Books I wouldn’t treat it as ‘gospel’ but some great additions have been made.

Gee, that list is really outdated. The author has a thing for HG Wells, apparently, as well, putting him in a few areas. I’d break it down by American (Twain, Fitzgerald with subspecialties like the Beats and Harlem Renaissance), British Lit (Dickens, Wells and maybe some Victorian), Continental European (lots of options here), I’d separate out Russian (which has tons of options), Latino/Caribbean, some Asian/African and then key nonfiction books, like Darwin, Marx… Maybe throw in some key science fiction or another genre; maybe “The Maltese Falcon.” The sky’s the limit.
